messages.message: That is the question I'd ask from AI :slightly_smiling_face: It can iterate over different configs really well
I was more interested in the history of these files, what they are used for, and why they don't work at all. Not sure an LLM can tell me that :slightly_smiling_face:

Challenge accepted :relaxed: 

Give a specific example please

>  Does anyone know how the docker images in `docker/` get built? The Makefile in there doesn't work; nor is there a README (edited)
Go!

Summary:
To build Docker images in docker/, use the bake script:
```cd docker
./bake [target]```
This is the supported and intended way to build those images. The Makefile is not required.

Well:
```cs/mfichman❯ ./bake
docker buildx bake -f docker-bake.hcl -f ib-services.hcl -f docker-bake/variables.hcl -f docker-bake/helpers.hcl --allow=fs.read=..
[+] Building 1.1s (7/7) FINISHED                                                                                       docker:default
 => [internal] load local bake definitions                                                                                       0.0s
 => => reading docker-bake.hcl 4.35kB / 4.35kB                                                                                   0.0s
 => => reading ib-services.hcl 12.45kB / 12.45kB                                                                                 0.0s
 => => reading docker-bake/variables.hcl 3.68kB / 3.68kB                                                                         0.0s
 => => reading docker-bake/helpers.hcl 2.82kB / 2.82kB                                                                           0.0s
 => [redis internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                       0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 2B                                                                                               0.0s
 => [job-service internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                 0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 2B                                                                                               0.0s
 => [configmap-reload internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                            0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 2B                                                                                               0.0s
 => [tempo internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                       0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 2B                                                                                               0.0s
 => [license-service internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                             0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 2B                                                                                               0.0s
 => CANCELED [connector-sharepoint internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                               0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile:                                                                                                  0.1s
ERROR: target redis: failed to solve: failed to read dockerfile: open Dockerfile: no such file or directory```
Anyway, I unblocked myself (I opted to fix the Makefile rather than ./bake)

"run it and fix any errors you find"
allowed it to find
```./bake base_images```
which is working, will report what AI can fix in our codebase once it tries
it almost fixed default target for me btw
I asked it to do detective work and check git logs to understand where it is broken
once it would run I send a PR :slightly_smiling_face:

I'm sending fixes there:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72226

./bake is actually working for me rn, but it still fails for some services, it iterate over it in order to fix
